Package com.eaio.nativecall

Interface Verifier

All Known Implementing Classes:
Win32Verifier
public interface Verifier
A Verifier implements method and module name checking for one given operating system. Classes implementing Verifier must be public and have a public no-argument constructor.
Author:
Johann Burkard

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String getDefaultModule()
    If there is a default module that system functions are stored in, the module's name may be returned here.
    java.lang.Object handleString​(java.lang.String val, java.lang.String module, java.lang.String function)
    Converts the given String to one of the following data types, based on the module and the function name:
    a byte array a char array
    boolean supports()
    Returns if this Verifier supports the given operating system.
    java.lang.String verifyFunctionName​(java.lang.String function)
    Verifies that the given function name is correct.
    java.lang.String verifyModuleName​(java.lang.String module)
    Verifies that the given module name is correct.

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultModule

      java.lang.String getDefaultModule()
      If there is a default module that system functions are stored in, the module's name may be returned here.
      Returns:
      the name of a default module or null
      See Also:
      NativeCall(String)

    • supports

      boolean supports() throws java.lang.SecurityException
      Returns if this Verifier supports the given operating system.
      Returns:
      if this operating system is supported
      Throws:
      java.lang.SecurityException - because System properties may be queried

    • verifyModuleName

      java.lang.String verifyModuleName​(java.lang.String module) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the given module name is correct.
      Parameters:
      module - the module name, may be null
      Returns:
      a module name, possibly modified, never null
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the module name is null and there is no default module defined
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the module is illegal in the operating system
      See Also:
      getDefaultModule()

    • verifyFunctionName

      java.lang.String verifyFunctionName​(java.lang.String function) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the given function name is correct.
      Parameters:
      function - the function name, may be null
      Returns:
      a function name, possibly modified, never null
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the function name is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the function is illegal in the operating system

    • handleString

      java.lang.Object handleString​(java.lang.String val, java.lang.String module, java.lang.String function)
      Converts the given String to one of the following data types, based on the module and the function name:
      • a byte array
      • a char array
      Parameters:
      val - the String, never null
      module - the module name, never null
      function - the function name, never null
      Returns:
      the String converted, never null
